column4: im trying to update 10.10 Ubuntu to firefox 4 by doing: sudo apt-add-repository ppa:mozillateam/firefox-stable then update and install firefox.. its keeps saying its already at the latest version 3.4?????
try sudo apt-get upgrade
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgrade
try the gui, system, administration, software sources
in the other tab, does the mozilla ppa appear?
iv checked that and no the mozilla ppa is not there. also not in /etc/apt/sources.list
try adding it again
http://ppa.launchpad.net/mozillateam/firefox-stable/ubuntu
ok ill add it through the gui this time. ;)
ok wow i tried adding: http://ppa.launchpad.net/mozillateam/firefox-stable/ubuntu through gui but its not showing up... very weird
hmmmm
try it through gedit now
the sources.lst file
will try
it has to appear
you mean sources.list not sources.lst right?
yes
ok after edit of sources.list and then update i get: GPG error: http://ppa.launchpad.net maverick Release: The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key
hmmm
that might have been the reason all other methods failed
glad that it's working now though
yea and lucky i know my way around ubuntu a bit. hope that does not happen to any new users.
